instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2936: What is 820-2936? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ALL_SYS_PWRGD: What is ALL_SYS_PWRGD? ALL_SYS_PWRGD is present when PP1V8_S3, PP5V_S3, PP1V2_S3, PP1V05_S0, PP5V_S0, PP3V3_S0, & PP1V5_S0 are present and working. If any of these rails is not working, ALL_SYS_PWRGD will be pulled down and the machine will not turn on. .
definitions.R7402: What is R7402? Resistor between PPVIN_S0_CPUIMVP and CPUIMVP_TON. TON stands for TIME ON â€“ CPUIMVP_TON configures the buck converter for the CPU based on its input power supply. If this resistor is blown, the machine will turn on but not have any image, chime, or POST, because CPU vcore will be missing. This resistor is often the first to corrode because it is along a high voltage rail and it is right on the edge of the board, check this on 2011-2012 model Macbook Pros that turn on and do not chime. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
checked all spi termination reistors and traces all is good even reprogrammed bios with no luck.

board had prior water damage it did at one point keep fan spinning but got no cpu checked the cpu ton resistors for <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> even replaced <CHIP>U7400</CHIP> still no luck and board is back to quarter fan spinning.

maybe its bad cpu?

checked the isl side resistors look fine not too sure where to look now.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
A shorted rail can also do this issue.
Did you check all rails, the one that are cycling with the fan goiing on aan off aad the one that are steady.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Do you get pulses on all big coils, even VCORE?
<SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M_SB</SIGNAL> correct oscillation?
<RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is OK?
<SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> is pulsing?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
All coild except the vcore ones pulse. L7520, L7510, L7550 dont pulse. <RESISTOR>R7402</RESISTOR> is fine <SIGNAL>ALL_SYS_PWRGD</SIGNAL> pulses

Cant check with an o-scope but i get a straight 0v no pulsing on <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M_SB</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
PCH requires <SIGNAL>SYSCLK_CLK25M_SB</SIGNAL>.
Check around <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and Y2805.
Change <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> if no way to properly check 25MHz.
You can get cheap analog o-scope from Internet adds; you will need it to confirm oscillation many times.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message: I changed both those and still same issue ill try n change it one more time

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message: Traces are good even replaced again and nothing

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message: Post DC voltage on <CHIP>U2800</CHIP> and Y2805.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Y2805

pin 1 - pulses up to 0.014v
pin 3 - fluctuates from 0.328v to 0.700v

<CHIP>U2800</CHIP>

pin 1 - 3.3v
pin 2 - 3.3v
pin 3 - pulses up to 0.023v
pin 4 - fluctuates 0.647v to 0.743v
pin 5 - pulses 1v
pin 6 - 1v
pin 8 -0.065v and drops to 0.055v
pin 9 - 0v
pin 11 - pulses 1.7v
pin 12 - 0.396v
pin 13 - 3.4v
pin 14 - pulses 2.4v
pin 15 - pulses 0.895v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
Change Y2805 and associated caps and resistors.
I have no idea what value should show pin 9 in DC scale; supposedly cannot stay at 0V.
I recommend you to get an o-scope, or frequency meter.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message: Before measuring i had replaced y2805 and associated caps i guess maybe 3rd times the charm?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message: Changed some caps still same issue im just gonna move on.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2936</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> quarter fan spin
threads.message:
You need to confirm 25MHz for PCH.
If missing, that is good reason the board doesn't work...
